channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves and debris on road, 4th December
item.description:
The winter leaves are blocking the run off of rain on the road causing deep puddles and not allowing drainage. Can they be cleared as they were today on the opposite side of the road?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 219, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage blocked, 4th December
item.description:
This was marked as completed two weeks ago, clearly no work actually took place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Huge pothole near building works, 4th December
item.description:
TERRIBLE pot hole, couldn’t see in the dark and it could’ve caused serious damage. The pothole is located near the building works and past the residential area on the Old Gloucester Road. It could be dangerous and I’m lucky it’s not caused any damage (from what I can see in the dark)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lobleys Drive east of the motorway bridge - flooding, 4th December
item.description:
Lobleys Drive east of the motorway bridge and opposite the recreation areas has once again got awful surface flooding due to poorly maintained drainage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding across ehole road for approximately 20m, 4th December
item.description:
Coopers edge side of lobleys Road bridge over M5, adjacent to coopers edge play park. Causing long delays, one vehicle at a time getting through water. Unknown start of flood, issue noted at 5pm today 4th December. This issue has occurred previously as drain not managing rain water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface subsiding, making it hard to get on drive, 4th December
item.description:
The problem is outside Broadclyst. I reported the problem in 2021 and was told it didn't meet the criteria for fixing. The tarmac that provides a gentle slope between the road and our drive has gradually been washed away, leaving the effect of a step between the road and our drive. For the last 2 years we have struggled to get on and off the drive and have needed new suspension in one of our cars. Yesterday a delivery lorry was reversing onto the drive and caught its rear step on the drive because of the difference in height between the road and our drive. I'm worried that we will get sued or companies will refuse to deliver us if this is not fixed soon. I'm also worried that the whole thing may collapse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 4th December
item.description:
I spoke to mum on Tuesday and she was very upset and agitated. Apparently, workmen started erecting a parking pole directly in front of her house, this will mean that cars will be able to park in that space adding to an already congested area
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is totally blocked and surface water cannot drain., 4th December
item.description:
Corner of Lansdown Parsde and Lansdown Rd....pavement and road alongside nursery school are impassable whenever it rains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 4th December
item.description:
Customer states she has walked on a bit of grass this afternoon, residents have come out of the property and shouted at her, they siad they have adopted the grass verge and not to walk on it. A male has threatened the customer and would follow them home and put dog faeces in their letter box. This sounds unlikely that an AHR would allow adoption of this grass area but they said they have paperwork. Sending for AHR to maybe inspect the location and see if any adjustments have been made to the area that may need rectifying by whoever has caused this. Customer was very upset by this and have advised they speak to the police in relation to the threats made towards them.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes the length of Bayshill Rd Cheltenham, 4th December
item.description:
We have just driven Bayshill Rd Cheltenham and can report that NONE OF THE POTHOLES THE LENGTH OF THIS ROAD HAVE BEEN FIXED! We are both misinformed! Please go and reinspect this road and arrange for some resurfacing between the Malmaison roundabout and traffic lights at St George’s Rd. thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayshill Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 4th December
item.description:
construction on the other side of Talbot Road which means there is a considerable amount of extra people and cars using Talbot Road. any plans in place to add a green arrow to the current set of traffic lights at the junction of Talbot Road and Lansdowne Road allowing traffic from GCHQ, and to turn right into Talbot Road and allow traffic from Talbot Road to turn right into Lansdowne Road towards town
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 4th December
item.description:
email rcvd 02.12.23 - Hello Highways Department. I live at: WESTAL HOUSE. 4 ANDOVER WALK. GL50. 2QY I notice that this week several potholes in our street have been marked with white stain which I presume means they are to be repaired. Directly outside our house, in the kerb, there is a large pothole/ channel which has not been marked. Please could this be included in the repair regime as it is deep and fills with water every time it rains. Kind regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Bollards Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, 4th December
item.description:
The Council told me more than a year ago that the bollard outside 30/32 would be replaced in the next financial year. This morning at 9.50am a huge Portuguese artic lorry, on the way to Postlip Mill, mounted the pavement missing the porch over our front door by just 3 inches and going over all the relevant drain covers in the pavement. There are at least 4 bollards missing in Gloucester Street that have not been replaced. Why? Is it the councils policy now to endanger life and property?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Streetlight outside 66 Beeches Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Beeches Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several pot holes and length of roadway need repair, 4th December
item.description:
In the past couple of weeks 7 or 8 areas have been marked up for repair. However, the majority of the white paint has disappeared, worn off or been washed away. Certainly 2 of these areas had been previously marked over a year ago and then when the maintenance team arrived the markings had been washed away. No repair happened as they said if it’s not marked it can’t be repaired. Please ensure this doesn’t happen this time as some of these pot holes are dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Brockhampton Road, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
